v.v: Yahweh, you who lead us as a shepherd leads his flock of sheep,
Show yourself to the people of the tribes of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh!
God, cause our nation to be strong like it was before;
Yahweh, commander of the angel armies,
It is as though the only food and drink that you have given us is a cup full of our tears!
You have allowed the people groups that surround us to argue with each other to decide which part of our land each of them will take;
God, Commander of the angel armies,
Our ancestors were like a grapevine that you brought out of Egypt;
As people clear ground to plant a grapevine,
As huge grapevines cover the hills with their shade
your people ruled all of Canaan, from the Mediterranean Sea in the west to the Euphrates River in the east.
So why have you abandoned us
wild pigs can trample the vines,
You who are the commander of the angel armies, turn to us!
who are like the young vine that you planted and caused to grow!
Our enemies have torn down and burned everything in our land;
But strengthen us people whom you have chosen,
When you do that, we will never turn away from you again;
Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, restore us;

v: you who sit on your throne in the Very Holy Place in the temple, above the figures of winged creatures,
come and do powerful things for us Israelite people.
Show us that you are powerful
and come and rescue us!
act kindly toward us so that we may be saved from our enemies!
how long will you be angry with us, your people, when we pray to you?
they laugh at us.
make our nation strong as it was before!
Act kindly toward us so that we may be saved!
you drove out the other people groups from this land,
and you put your people in their land.
you cleared out the people who were living in this land for us to live in it.
As the roots of a grapevine go deep down into the ground and spread,
you enabled our ancestors to prosper and start living in towns all over this land.
and as their branches are taller than big cedar trees,
and allowed our enemies to tear down our walls?
You are like someone who tears down the fences around his vineyard,
so that all the people who pass by can steal the grapes;
and wild animals can also eat the grapes.
Look down from heaven and see what is happening to us!
Come and rescue us who are like your grapevine,
look at them angrily and get rid of them!
us Israelite people, whom you previously caused to be very strong.
revive us, and then we will praise you.
act kindly toward us and rescue us from our enemies!
